gen:ReportedAttribute.com:Text: Objective 13. Take urgent action to combat climate change and its repercussions2
13.1 Build resilience and adaptation capacities in all countries to climate hazards and climate-related natural disasters
13.1.1 Number of people who died, disappeared or directly affected during disasters, per 100,000 people
Ministry of Public Security and Disaster Management
OPC2 HABIMANA Apollinaire
Statistical service
SDG focal point within the Ministry
apollohabo@gmail.com
Number of people who died, disappeared or directly affected in disasters, per 100,000 people
Number
MSPGC Statistical Yearbook
Administrative data
Annual
Annual
MSPGC
MSPGC
The Ministerial departments are the members of the SSN whose mission is to collect, process and disseminate the data of their sector.
The indicator is relevant because it allows monitoring of the Sendhai Framework
The completeness of this indicator depends on the regular collection of disaster data
Count of dead, missing or directly affected by disasters, per 100,000 people
Validation is carried out at two levels: Internal level and at CTIS level
The indicator is available at national level
The indicator can be compared to other indicators at the international level
Statistical yearbook of the Ministry

Objective 13. Take urgent action to combat climate change and its repercussions2
13.2 Incorporate climate change measures into national policies, strategies and planning
13.2.1 Number of national communications prepared on the implementation of the policy aimed at improving climate change
Ministry of the Environment, Agriculture and Livestock
MBAZUMUTIMANA Dieudonne
Statistical service
SDG focal point within the Ministry
dembaze@yahoo.fr
This is the number of national communications prepared on the implementation of the policy aimed at improving climate change
Number
Annual report on the achievements of the OBPE
Administrative data
Annual
Annual
MINEAGRIE
MINEAGRIE
The Ministerial departments are the members of the SSN whose mission is to collect, process and disseminate the data of their sector.
The indicator is relevant because it reflects the state of environmental protection
The exhaustiveness of this indicator depends on the regular reporting of the activities carried out in this area.
Count of national communications prepared on the implementation of the policy aimed at improving climate change
This indicator is validated internally only
The indicator is available at national level
The indicator can be compared to other indicators of the same type at regional and international level
National Communication 2011

Objective 13. Take urgent action to combat climate change and its repercussions2

13.a Implement the commitment that the developed countries parties to the United Nations Framework Convention on Climate Change have made to jointly mobilize from multiple sources $ 100 billion per year by 2020 to meet the needs developing countries with regard to concrete mitigation measures and the transparency of their implementation and make the Green Climate Fund fully operational by providing it as soon as possible with the necessary financial resources
13.a.1 Amount (in United States dollars) of resources mobilized per year, from 2020 to 2025, under the commitment of 100 billion dollars
category III
Category III

13.a.1 Amount (in United States dollars) of resources mobilized per year, from 2020 to 2025, under the commitment of 100 billion dollars
category III
Category III

Objective 13. Take urgent action to combat climate change and its repercussions2

13.b Promote capacity building mechanisms so that the least developed countries and small island developing States equip themselves with effective planning and management capacity to face climate change, with particular emphasis on women, youth, local people and marginalized groups

13.b.1 Number of least developed countries and small island developing States receiving specialized support for the establishment of effective planning and management resources in the face of climate change, with particular emphasis on women, youth , the local population and marginalized groups, and the importance of this support in terms of funding, technology and capacity building
category III
Category III
